channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Glastonbury
channel.desc: Clara Amfo, Jack Saunders and Jo Whiley are live as the sun begins to set on the final day of Glastonbury Festival.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Past Lives
channel.desc: Nora and Hae Sung, two deeply connected childhood friends, are wrest apart after Nora's family emigrates from South Korea. Decades later, they are reunited for one fateful week as they confront destiny, love and the choices that make a life.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Bonnie and Clyde
channel.desc: Celebrated tale about the rise and fall of two violent young outlaws and their gang, based on the lives of the two most notorious American outlaws of the 1930s - Bonnie Parker and Clyde Barrow. The film became a cinematic landmark because of its groundbreaking, realistic and brutal scenes of violence, and won two Oscars.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Moment of Proof
channel.desc: A reclusive millionaire is found murdered in his home in west London, and police find hundreds of thousands of pounds in cash there. Why have his killers not taken the money? Only old-fashioned detective work can find them, but they have fled abroad.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
channel.desc: An array of delicious recipes from Rosie Birkett, Mike Reid, Danilo Cortellini and Genevieve Taylor. And Rick Stein and the Hairy Bikers head out and about across the UK.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Springwatch
channel.desc: There are updates from live nest cameras on site at the Longshaw Estate, where Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan are poised to capture the beauty of the season. Iolo Williams is broadcasting live from the spectacular Rathlin Island Seabird Centre.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Politics Live
channel.desc: Jo Coburn invites a panel of guests to share their opinions on the newsmaking stories of the day.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: Wimbledon 2025
channel.desc: Live coverage from the opening day of the 2025 Championships at Wimbledon, with the 128 players in the men's and women's singles draws dreaming of glory at the All England Club. Among them are Spain's Carlos Alcaraz, who is aiming to win the title for the third year in a row, and who arrives in south west London in top form after retaining his French Open title by beating world number one Jannik Sinner in an unforgettable final in Paris. Introduced by Isa Guha.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: Wimbledon 2025
channel.desc: Clare Balding presents continuing live coverage from Wimbledon, where the 2025 Championships are in full swing. Eighth-ranked Zheng Qinwen was the highest seed to lose on the first day in 2024. However, the Chinese player bounced back to win the Olympic title the following month and is back this year, hoping for better luck on the grass at the All England Club.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: EastEnders
channel.desc: Residents of Albert Square in London's East End deal with life, love and loss. The long-running and popular soap opera focuses on family relationships and a sense of belonging in the community, and has been known to tackle hard-hitting topics.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: EastEnders
channel.desc: Residents of Albert Square in London's East End deal with life, love and loss. The long-running and popular soap opera focuses on family relationships and a sense of belonging in the community, and has been known to tackle hard-hitting topics.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Your Garden Made Perfect
channel.desc: Agata and David live in Benfleet, Essex. They were initially attracted to their lovely new family home because of its massive garden. They thought it would be an ideal space for their autistic son Franik to enjoy being outside. However, they soon found that the size and awkward L-shape was a problem, because it was difficult to keep an eye on him. They are constantly concerned that Franik could hurt himself.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Scrublands: Silver
channel.desc: After a long break, Martin Scarsden returns to his hometown in the hopes of spending a quiet vacation with his new partner, Mandy Bond. But his plans take a turn when his mate Jasper Speight is found dead and the only witness and suspect is Mandy.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: A Wild Year
channel.desc: It's April, and in one the region's most sheltered harbours, local crab fishermen are making the most of the ideal conditions.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Upstart Crow
channel.desc: Will is off to Stratford to get some serious writing done, but his bullying former school teacher invites himself to stay. Will has to confront his childhood demons, and it soon turns out there's more at stake.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Couples Therapy
channel.desc: Alison has an epiphany; Kyle recounts painful childhood memories; Boris explores the roots of his restlessness; Orna encourages Nick to open up.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Couples Therapy
channel.desc: Nick reveals a traumatic episode that shaped his relationship with Katherine; Rod pushes back on Alison; Orna is met with defiance from Boris.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Antiques Roadshow
channel.desc: The roadshow is at Firstsite contemporary art gallery in Colchester, Essex, where treasures include a spin painting by Damien Hirst, a watch with a racy past and logbooks from the real-life `Great Escape'.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Lifeline
channel.desc: Joely Richardson presents an appeal on behalf of `Supporting Wounded Veterans', a charity that supports ex-service personnel as they transition into civilian life, through mentoring, sport rehabilitation and pain management programmes.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Moment of Proof
channel.desc: Two people die in an arson attack on their home, but police can't get a DNA profile from matches left at the scene. Then, an eagle-eyed detective clocks a problem with the CCTV footage.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Money for Nothing
channel.desc: Bag maker Neil pitches an idea for an old tent, and JJ Chalmers tries a first, turning a sewing machine stand into seating.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Springwatch
channel.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan explore stories from Longshaw Estate. Iolo Williams broadcasts live from stunning Rathlin Island, where he explores the world of corncrake. Iolo examines island's conservation efforts for the endangered species.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: Wimbledon 2025
channel.desc: Live action from day two of Wimbledon, where the world's top tennis players have gathered to battle it out at the third grand slam of the season. As is tradition, the first match on Centre Court on the second day of the Championships features the defending women's champion, with Barbora Krejcikova of the Czech Republic getting proceedings under way in the world's most iconic tennis arena. Presented by Isa Guha.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: Wimbledon 2025
channel.desc: Clare Balding hosts further live coverage of the 2025 Championships at Wimbledon. Left-hander Jack Draper was among the winners on this day last year and the Briton has had a fantastic last 12 months, including reaching the semi-finals of the US Open and racing up the world rankings, so he will have high hopes of reaching the latter stages at his home grand slam.

channel.title: Digging for Britain
channel.desc: In the west of Britain, there's a rare medieval cemetery, a disappearing Mesolithic landscape, a mysterious Iron Age burial and the ruins of a Gothic masterpiece.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Scrublands: Silver
channel.desc: As Martin continues to investigate the events surrounding Jasper's murder, he and Mandy learn that someone, probably Jasper, drugged her; when family members discuss an old betrayal with Martin, Mandy becomes concerned about their relationship.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: A Wild Year
channel.desc: In the north east of England lies a wild and remote moorland. This ancient landscape of heather-clad uplands and sheltered dales is home to red grouse and tough moorland sheep.

channel.title: QI
channel.desc: Sandi Toksvig invites viewers to join her in the QI restaurant, with Alan Davies, Phill Jupitus, Sara Pascoe and Mark Watson.

channel.desc: Qasa Alom looks back at the day's play at Wimbledon, with highlights from the big matches. There's also analysis and discussion of the main talking points from the action at the All England Club.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Great British Railway Journeys
channel.desc: Michael Portillo's rail exploration of the spectacular countryside of the Weald in Surrey, Sussex and Kent continues - this time, aboard the Gatwick Express train. Michael heads for Buckhurst Park, seat of the Sackville family.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Amol Rajan Interviews
channel.desc: Amol Rajan sits down with Martina Navratilova to discuss the multiple challenges she overcame, on and off the court, to become one of the world's greatest tennis players.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Moment of Proof
channel.desc: When a missing woman is found buried in her own back garden, family and friends raise suspicions about her long - term boyfriend. But police don't have much to go on - until he flees to Estonia.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Bargain Hunt
channel.desc: Presenter Christina Trevanion delves into the fascinating history of the Glastonbury music festival. Two couples compete as they shop for antiques at the Bath and West Showground in Shepton Mallet, alongside experts Kate Bliss and Gary Pe.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
channel.desc: Musical mates Samantha Fox and Sinitta are grooving in their 1987 Lotus Excel, rocking their way through Kent and Surrey. With ?400 each to spend, their support acts are Steven Moore and Tim Medhurst.

channel.title: Live: Wimbledon 2025
channel.desc: Continued live coverage from Wimbledon, where the second round is taking place. Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner have shared the last six grand slams between them, and they will fancy their chances of extending that run. For Spaniard Alcaraz, it would mean a third consecutive Wimbledon title, while Italian Sinner would be lifting the cup here for the first time. Presented by Isa Guha.

channel.title: The Moment of Proof
channel.desc: Two men heading to a business meeting are kidnapped and forced to transfer a large amount of company money. Police need to unpick a complicated web of phone calls and CCTV to find their moment of proof.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Homes Under the Hammer
channel.desc: Jacqui can't get outside because of overgrown gardens at properties in Kent and Norfolk. Dion's in Liverpool, where a huge project offers equally massive potential.

channel.desc: Longmeadow is exploding with summer colour, and Monty is potting up scented pelargoniums for their fragrance. Meanwhile, Toby Buckland visits horticultural gem Stockton Bury Gardens in Herefordshire.

channel.title: Live: Wimbledon 2025
channel.desc: Isa Guha introduces live coverage from day four of Wimbledon, one of the highlights of the sporting summer. On this day in 2024, British wild card Jacob Fearnley took a set off seven-time champion Novak Djokovic on Centre Court. It proved to be real springboard for the Scot, who has powered up the rankings this year to earn direct entry into the Wimbledon draw.

channel.title: Saving Lives at Sea
channel.desc: The North Berwick crew try to save a windsurfer battling stormy seas. Meanwhile, the Lymington crew race to the rescue of an elderly casualty whose yacht is caught on a lobster pot.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Detectorists
channel.desc: `There's something about karma going on' is Lance's wise observation, and there certainly seems to be something in the air. They have one last day on the farm, one last chance to pull out all the stops and find that gold. Terry's got a new gazebo, and it's the perfect time for a rally.
